qa_multi_document_information_integratio.question: According to the hospitalization records of Granville General Hospital and Victoria General Hospital, what were the chief complaints of patients J. Rodriguez and Y. Mendoza?

content: Chief Complaint: Local redness, swelling, heat, and pain on the right forearm for 3 days.
Crying, limited mouth opening, difficulty sucking for 8 hours.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.answer: According to the hospitalization records of Granville General Hospital, the chief complaint of patient J. Rodriguez was local redness, swelling, heat, and pain on the right forearm for 3 days. According to the hospitalization records of Victoria General Hospital, the chief complaint of patient Y. Mendoza was crying, limited mouth opening, and difficulty sucking for 8 hours.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.question: According to the hospitalization records of Granville General Hospital and Victoria General Hospital, what were the preliminary diagnoses for patients J. Rodriguez and Y. Mendoza?

content: Preliminary Diagnosis: Furuncle of the right forearm

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.answer: According to the hospitalization records of Granville General Hospital, the preliminary diagnosis for patient J. Rodriguez was a furuncle of the right forearm. According to the hospitalization records of Victoria General Hospital, the preliminary diagnosis for patient Y. Mendoza was neonatal tetanus.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.question: According to the hospitalization records of Granville General Hospital and Victoria General Hospital, what were the auxiliary examination results for patients J. Rodriguez and Y. Mendoza?

content: Auxiliary Examination: Complete Blood Count (CBC) showed mild leukocytosis, no other significant findings
Auxiliary Examination Reports: Complete Blood Count (CBC): mild leukocytosis

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.answer: According to the hospitalization records of Granville General Hospital, the auxiliary examination for patient J. Rodriguez showed a complete blood count (CBC) with mild leukocytosis. According to the hospitalization records of Victoria General Hospital, the auxiliary examination for patient Y. Mendoza showed a normal CBC, slightly elevated CRP, and pending blood cultures and CSF examination.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.question: According to the hospitalization records of Granville General Hospital and Victoria General Hospital, what were the long-term medical orders for patients J. Rodriguez and Y. Mendoza?

content: Long-term Orders: Topical antibiotics (Mupirocin ointment) applied to affected area twice daily; Oral antibiotics (Cephalexin 250 mg) three times daily for 7 days
Long-term Orders: Monitor vital signs every 2 hours.
Provide IV fluids and nutrition support.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.answer: According to the hospitalization records of Granville General Hospital, the long-term medical orders for patient J. Rodriguez included topical antibiotics (Mupirocin ointment) applied to the affected area twice daily and oral antibiotics (Cephalexin 250 mg) three times daily for 7 days. According to the hospitalization records of Victoria General Hospital, the long-term medical orders for patient Y. Mendoza included monitoring vital signs every 2 hours, continuing empirical antibiotic therapy, and providing IV fluids and nutrition support.

qa_multi_document_compare.question: According to the hospitalization records of Granville General Hospital and Victoria General Hospital, how do the ages of J. Rodriguez and Y. Mendoza at the time of admission compare?
qa_multi_document_compare.answer: J. Rodriguez was admitted at 7 years old, while Y. Mendoza was admitted 8 hours after birth. J. Rodriguez was significantly older at the time of admission compared to Y. Mendoza.

qa_multi_document_compare.question: According to the hospitalization records of Granville General Hospital and Victoria General Hospital, who was admitted earlier, J. Rodriguez or Y. Mendoza?
qa_multi_document_compare.answer: J. Rodriguez was admitted on February 26, and Y. Mendoza was admitted on March 10. J. Rodriguez was admitted earlier.
